channel.title: cata-list
channel.description: Useful lists of some of the best info, media, tools, and quotes for those who seek to understand and improve this world.

item.title: This Is How Democracy Dies
item.description: If machines make all our decisions, who's in charge?

item.title: Twitter Sees Jump in Govt Demands to Remove Content of Reporters, News Outlets
item.description: Twitter Inc (TWTR.N) saw a surge in government demands worldwide in 2020 to take down content posted by journalists and news outlets, according to data released by the social media platform.

item.title: U.S. Health Official Says COVID-19 Boosters Could Risk More Serious Side Effects
item.description: The United States is reviewing the need for a third COVID-19 booster shot among residents who have already been vaccinated but needs to see more data to know if additional shots could raise people's risk of serious side effects, a U.S. health official said Tuesday.

item.title: Almost Four Decades After Its Birth, the Diversity Industry Thrives on Its Own Failures
item.description: Campus diversity advocates have pulled off their greatest coup to date: They have declared 'diversity' to be a freestanding academic discipline, thus injecting their bureaucracy-heavy apparatus int…

item.title: E.P.A. Approved Toxic Chemicals for Fracking a Decade Ago, New Files Show
item.description: The compounds can form PFAS, also known as 'forever chemicals,' which have been linked to cancer and birth defects. The E.P.A. approvals came despite the agency's own concerns about toxicity.

item.title: The Strange Rehabilitation of the Black Panther Party
item.description: Isn't it a little late for the rehabilitation of the Black Panther Party (BPP)? After all, the organization that first caught the public's attention in 1969 was already in its death thr…

item.title: U.S. Puts New Warning on J&J Coronavirus Vaccine for Autoimmune Disorder
item.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Monday added a warning to the fact sheet for Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ.N) COVID-19 vaccine saying that data suggests there is an increased risk of a rare neurological disorder in the six weeks after inoculation.

item.title: A Witch Trial at the Legal Aid Society
item.description: Maud Maron was a model public defender. Then she was forced out of her job because of her political views and her race.

item.title: Study Projects a Surge in Coastal Flooding, Starting in 2030s
item.description: In the mid-2030s, every U.S. coast will experience rapidly increasing high-tide floods, when a lunar cycle will amplify rising sea levels caused by climate change.

item.title: Solar Is Dirt-Cheap and About to Get Even More Powerful
item.description: After focusing for decades on cutting costs, the solar industry is shifting attention to making new advances in technology.

item.title: Is 'Critical Race Theory' the Wrong Term?
item.description: Are Republicans tilting at the wrong windmill? New Substack author Wesley Yang, who coined the term 'Successor Ideology,' describes a movement that goes far beyond race

item.title: Could You Resist a Cult?
item.description: Many of us yearn to be told what to do

item.title: 'Heat Dome' Probably Killed 1bn Marine Animals on Canada Coast, Experts Say
item.description: British Columbia scientist says heat essentially cooked mussels: 'The shore doesn't usually crunch when you walk'

item.title: Global Wind and Solar Power Capacity Grew at Record Rate in 2020
item.description: BP's annual report reveals renewable energy boom in pandemic coincided with slump in demand for oil

item.title: The Capitol Police, Armed With $2 Billion in New Funding, Expanding Operations Outside of D.C.
item.description: AOC and two other Squad members -- who spent months chanting 'Defund the Police' -- had the power to stop this, but instead voted 'present' to ensure it passed.

item.title: 15 States Reach a Deal With Purdue Pharma, Advancing a $4.5 Billion Opioids Settlement
item.description: The states, including Massachusetts and New York, agreed to drop opposition to the bankruptcy organization plan of the company, the maker of OxyContin.

item.title: How All My Politically Correct Bones Were Broken
item.description: In my first 10 years of college teaching, from the mid-60s to mid-70s, I modeled myself on my best teachers—men and women who questioned my ideas vigorously. They let me know that I mattered to the…

item.title: Pacific Northwest Heat Wave 'Virtually Impossible' Without Climate Change - Research
item.description: The suffocating heat wave that killed hundreds of people across the Pacific Northwest last week would have been 'virtually impossible' without climate change, a study has found.

item.title: Rep. Ken Buck (R-CO) Speaks Out on Reining in Big Tech and Why Many House Members Refuse
item.description: As House Republicans vocally denounce Big Tech in media appearances, many simultaneously use their power to impede legislative reform. Rep. Buck is acting.

item.title: An Ugly War Among Leftist YouTubers Shows Two Common, Toxic Pathologies Plaguing U.S. Politics
item.description: Baselessly accusing people of being Russian agents and weaponizing accusations of sexual misconduct are reputation-destroying cancers at the heart of liberal discourse.

item.description: YouTube's use of government guidelines to regulate speech raises serious questions, both about the First Amendment and regulatory capture

item.title: Whistleblowers Expose Corruption in EPA Chemical Safety Office
item.description: EPA managers removed information about the risks posed by dozens of chemicals, according to whistleblowers.

item.title: We Now Know How Exxon Secretly Fights Crackdowns on Plastic Pollution
item.description: In a sting operation by Greenpeace UK, a top Exxon official admits Exxon's producing PFAS products and lobbying against anti-plastic laws.

item.description: A sting by Greenpeace UK exposes how the company talks a big climate game while ensuring nothing actually gets done.

item.title: Ivermectin for Prevention and Treatment of COVID-19
item.description: Moderate-certainty evidence finds that large reductions in COVID-19 deaths are possible using ivermectin. Using ivermectin early in the clinical course may reduce numbers progressing to severe disease. The apparent safety and low cost suggest that ivermectin is likely to have a significant impact on the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic globally.

item.title: Our Endless Dinner With Robin DiAngelo
item.description: Suburban America's self-proclaimed racial oracle returns with a monumentally oblivious sequel to 'White Fragility'

item.title: How Pesticide Companies Corrupted the EPA and Poisoned America
item.description: Pesticide manufacturers that have long dodged regulation by the EPA now face billions in damages for causing cancer, brain damage, and Parkinson's disease.

item.description: Would you like to know a secret?

item.title: Advertisers Are Selling Americans' Data to Hundreds of Shady Foreign Businesses
item.description: A new report shows advertisers don't seem to have qualms with selling intimate consumer data to foreign companies, including those based in Russia and China.

item.description: Can the US government tolerate the existence of a rival within its territory?

item.title: Lakes Are Losing Oxygen — and Their Inhabitants Are in Danger
item.description: Hundreds of temperate lakes around the world are showing trends toward anoxia, becoming warmer, murkier, and less hospitable to cold-water species.

item.title: Biden's Lawless Bombing of Iraq and Syria Only Serves the Weapons Industry Funding Both Parties
item.description: U.S. citizens derive no benefit, but instead suffer great loss, from endless war in the Middle East. But their interests are irrelevant to decisions of bipartisan Washington.

item.title: Amazon's Woke Smokescreen
item.description: The new inclusion policy put out by Amazon Studios offers entries on 'womxn' and 'acquired limb difference.' Meantime, the company's drivers urinate in bottles.

item.description: The heat-caused damage in the Pacific Northwest is a stark sign of how screwed our infrastructure is when it comes to climate change.

item.description: Adults will be able to cultivate and consume the drug, but smoking in public remains banned.

item.title: When a Free Society Becomes a Police State
item.description: For 26 years, the pro-democracy tabloid Apple Daily was a thorn in Beijing's side. This week, the paper closed for good. What its death means for Hong Kong — and for us all.

item.title: Bearing Witness to the End of Hong Kong's Free Press
item.description: My conversation with an intrepid Apple Daily reporter.

item.title: CRISPR Gene Editing Breakthrough Could Treat Many More Diseases
item.description: Researchers have discovered that you can inject CRISPR gene editing directly into the bloodstream, potentially leading to effective treatments for many diseases..

item.description: Central to 'Canceling Comedians While the World Burns' is the question of whether the western left wants to win. Watch my 50-minute discussion with the author.

item.description: That the White House violently cleared Lafayette Park at Trump's behest was treated as unquestioned truth by most corporate media. Today it was revealed as a falsehood.
